image.altText: Wiradjuri woman Tara Croker who launched startup Yaala Sparkling smiles at the camera while sitting indoors

props.synopsis: The Indigenous business sector is experiencing significant growth but challenges remain around access to capital, a lack of culturally safe support and entrenched racism.

title.children: Why a new wave of Indigenous businesses are failing to meet full potential

image.altText: Luke Tribe and his new dog Fosse

props.synopsis: Luke Tribe didn't feel ready to get another dog soon after saying goodbye to his best friend of 10 years. But that time did eventually come.

title.children: When is the right time to get a dog after losing one?

image.altText: Three women in black formal wear walk out of court, one in front holding folders and looking at camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the family of Kumanjayi Johnson, who died in Alice Springs while under public guardianship, tell an inquest his family felt left out of his care and weren't told he went missing on the night he disappeared.

title.children: Inquest into death of Aboriginal man in care hears of support gaps

image.altText: Aerial shot of rough surf against rock cliffs, rescue jet ski travels through water

props.synopsis: Two men remain missing since Friday, one in NSW and the other in Victoria, as the search to recover their bodies has so far failed.

title.children: Drowning death toll rises to six in 'worst Easter long weekend'

image.altText: Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri on the Jeddah podium

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri becomes the first Australian to lead Formula 1 drivers' championship in 15 years, passing Max Verstappen on the first corner en route to victory in Saudi Arabia.

title.children: 'He forced me off': Red Bull unhappy as penalty hands Piastri Saudi win

image.altText: A woman wearing a nun's head piece standing and singing at a church service.

props.synopsis: Israel Police have been accused of turning Jerusalem's Old City into a "militarised zone" and blocking worshippers from praying over Easter, after violent scuffles broke out near one of Christianity's holiest sites.

title.children: Christians criticise Israeli police for actions in Jerusalem over Easter

image.altText: A woman crying

props.synopsis: One commander has been dismissed as a result of an investigation into the killing of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency workers, who were found in a shallow grave a month ago.

title.children: Israel says killing of Palestinian medics the result of 'poor night visibility'

image.altText: Putin crosses his chest while holding a red candle sanding next to the Moscow mayor crossing his forehead.

props.synopsis: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russia is making a pretence of a ceasefire to advance on Ukraine's front line.

title.children: Ukraine says Russia has ramped up attacks despite ceasefire

image.altText: More than a thousand dolphins can be killed in annual hunts in Solomon Islands

props.synopsis: A video showing the slaughter of hundreds of dolphins in Solomon Islands has gone viral on social media, sparking heated debate in Solomon Islands and the broader Pacific about the ancient practice.

title.children: 'Dolphin hunt' continues on this island, as debate rages over ancient practice

props.synopsis: John King captured footage of a 100-metre-tall fire column only 50 metres from his back door. Fire analysts say the phenomenon is becoming more common as the climate changes.

title.children: CFA volunteers were ready for fire season, but not for a 100m fire column

image.altText: A young man with blond hair in a suit stands next to an older man with glasses.

props.synopsis: A how-to-vote-card released by the Greens on Sunday instructs voters to pencil in a federal candidate who last week formally removed himself from the race, opening the party to criticism the move is a cash grab.

title.children: Greens urge supporters to vote for dropped candidate

image.altText: The pope speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: The pope, who is still recovering from a near-fatal bout of double pneumonia, drew cheers and applause from the gathered crowds.

title.children: Pope Francis appears at Easter Sunday to deliver blessing as recovery continues

image.altText: Brisbane inner city rooftops

props.synopsis: Do home owners ever complain when house prices rise? A former prime minister said they didn't, but we're now dealing with the fallout.

title.children: The year housing turned toxic was captured in a talkback chat with PM

image.altText: Minister for Women's Safety Anne Ruston

props.synopsis: The Coalition has accused Labor of "disgraceful" lies about claims a future Dutton government would scrap almost 90 existing urgent care clinics.

title.children: Coalition accuses Labor of scare tactics over claims it will cut clinics

image.altText: Sam Darcy holds his injured right knee.

props.synopsis: In the aftermath of their 71-victory over St Kilda, the Western Bulldogs will be sweating on Sam Darcy's scan results after he was forced from the field with a serious knee injury. Follow live.

title.children: Bulldogs win but fear 'the worst' as Darcy suffers suspected ACL injury

image.altText: A man smiles widely as he stands in front of a large wooden cross on a grassy hill with the sun rising in the background

props.synopsis: The faithful have gathered throughout Australia to mark one of the holiest days on the Christian calendar.

title.children: Australian Christians celebrate Easter Sunday across the nation

image.altText: Wiradjuri woman Tara Croker who launched startup Yaala Sparkling smiles at the camera while sitting indoors

props.synopsis: The Indigenous business sector is experiencing significant growth but challenges remain around access to capital, a lack of culturally safe support and entrenched racism.

title.children: Why a new wave of Indigenous businesses are failing to meet full potential

image.altText: Cartoon characters Bart, Marge, Homer, Lisa and baby Maggie

props.synopsis: More than 35 years on from its debut, The Simpsons has been extended, but US Census data shows the nature of a typical family life has vastly changed since the beloved show has been on-air.

title.children: The Simpsons are no longer 'ordinary', but the show's been extended

image.altText: A white police car turns in front of a well-lit brown building at night on a deserted city street.

props.synopsis: The state opposition says it's obtained documents showing Melbourne's first COVID curfew was announced without proper health advice.

title.children: FOI reveals idea for a Melb COVID curfew did not come from health experts

image.altText: A person dressed in drag holding a sign saying 'facism is not pretty'

props.synopsis: The demonstrations ranged from a march through Manhattan and a rally in front of the White House to a demonstration at a Massachusetts Revolutionary War commemoration.

title.children: 'Sometimes we have to fight': Thousands protest against Trump across the US

image.altText: black and white photo of a woman with dark hair in a pale shirt, vest and beads with elbow on table resting head on knuckles

props.synopsis: In 1972 an Australian woman could not even open a bank account without the backing of a man. This is the inside story of how a group of feminists forced political change.

title.children: Meet the woman who turned female votes into political dynamite

image.altText: A man in a white space suit in carried by others in blue

props.synopsis: NASA astronaut Don Pettit, who spent 220 days in the ISS and orbited the Earth 3,520 times, landed back on Earth in Kazakhstan on Saturday local time.

title.children: NASA astronaut celebrates 70th birthday with return to Earth

image.altText: Woman wearing intricate gold costume and black makeup on face.

props.synopsis: If Donald Trump can be president, Deborah Kelly reasoned, then she could start a religion. The artist's project began as a parody, but soon morphed into a genuine source of spiritual solace for a growing community.

title.children: This religion started as a 'joke', then it took on a life of its own

image.altText: Newcastle player is tackled by Sharks players

props.synopsis: The Sharks hammered the insipid Knights 34-14 in Newcastle. Earlier, the Titans led Canberra 16-0 in their contest on the Gold Coast, before the Raiders roared back to win 30-20.

title.children: Knights deliver 'horror show' in hammering by Sharks

image.altText: A portrait photo of a man in a suit with glasses with an interior of an office in the background

props.synopsis: Two student reporters scramble to cover Harvard’s funding freeze amid escalating tensions with Donald Trump.

title.children: Harvard will not 'kiss the ring' as its law professors sue the US government

image.altText: A young girl with her brown hair in a pony tail in a pink jumper holds her hands under her chin as she gazes at a keyboard.

props.synopsis: Parents and researchers hope the discovery of a genetic mutation could help find treatments for children living with previously undiagnosed neurodevelopmental disorders.

title.children: Discovery of genetic mutation leads to first diagnosis for dozens of kids

image.altText: An Indigenous man wearing a cap, watch and black singlet looks up at a camera while seated outdoors.

props.synopsis: Brenton Shar walked away from his father's house one dark night and never came home. His family is still searching for answers, as a senator calls for a federal investigation into missing Indigenous men in Australia.

title.children: On a dark night, Brenton left his dad's home and was never seen again

image.altText: Police officers stand on the footpath of a city street which is blocked by police tape at night.

props.synopsis: Homicide Squad detectives are investigating the death of a man in Melbourne's inner south-east this morning, along with an unrelated serious assault of a woman in the coastal town of Barwon Heads.

title.children: Man fatally stabbed in Melbourne's popular Chapel Street nightclub strip

image.altText: Peter Dutton inspecting new housing development.

props.synopsis: Coalition MPs say 14 days is an eternity in politics and the party can reclaim ground before voting day in two weeks' time — even as it fends off new claims the Coalition would revive its unpopular work from home plan after the election.

title.children: Coalition frontbenchers say party not 'waving a white flag'

image.altText: A woman dressed up as a grandmother, standing on an apple float in a parade.

props.synopsis: The Granny Smith green apple is one of Australia's most famous exports — and it's all thanks to the propagating prowess of a grandmother.

title.children: A 'chance seedling' in a Sydney backyard became a fruit staple for the world

image.altText: Woman looking at paper document

props.synopsis: An antithesis to mass-produced chipboard furniture, a Tasmanian designer is making pieces that should last "hundreds of years".

title.children: You've heard of fast fashion. What about fast furniture?

image.altText: A woman shopping for groceries.

props.synopsis: Vote Compass data shows cost of living is the most important issue for respondents ahead of the federal election.

title.children: Vote Compass data shows rise in importance of cost of living for voters

image.altText: Luke Tribe and his new dog Fosse

props.synopsis: Luke Tribe didn't feel ready to get another dog soon after saying goodbye to his best friend of 10 years. But that time did eventually come.

title.children: When is the right time to get a dog after losing one?

image.altText: A man in a red polo sits on top of a bus in front of a red hill, with workers listening to him.

props.synopsis: As a storm brews over federal industrial relations changes, government critics say increased worker power will take the resource-rich Pilbara region back to the "bad old days" of union power. But how bad were they?

title.children: Will the government's new IR laws bring the Pilbara back to the 'bad old days'?

image.altText: A crowd of people gathered with some waving banners and flags while Big Ben looms behind them in the background

props.synopsis: Trans rights protesters gather in the English capital to protest against the UK's Supreme Court ruling that a woman is someone born biologically female.

title.children: Thousands of trans rights supporters rally in Central London
